result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua C Amend

records.addlTxt:
[ae] cases 22CF192, 21CF2, 21CF10, 21CF226, 21CF64 called 9:07 am  Defendant Joshua C Amend in court with Attorney Steven John Luchsinger. Attorney Jeffrey Martin Shock in court for State of Wisconsin. 

All cases except for 22CF192 were set for court trial today, parties have reached an agreement and would like to proceed to plea/sentencing today

Victim Rights is in compliance, ADA Shock will be e-filing the Victim Impact Statement 

Maximum penalties are recited; Constitutional rights are reviewed; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count 1 of 21CF10, Count 1 of 21CF2 and Count 1 of 21CF226 factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance is verified.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses remaining counts and cases 22CF192/21CF64

Sentencing recommendations/ arguments given by Counsel 

As to Count 1 of 21CF10, Count 1 of 21CF2 and Count 1 of 21CF226 The Court imposes 1 year in the Jefferson County Jail with Huber, with each count being concurrent to one another but consecutive to any sentence in being. The Court STAYS these sentences and places the Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling per Agent
--Contact with Victim 1 (MC) allowed by probation Agent


Separate from the conditions of Probation, the Court orders payment of costs, fees and surcharges through the Clerk of Courts Office. [Clerk calculates this total to be: $1,554]. The Court grants installment payments of $20 per month beginning 11/01/2022 and on the 1st day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment will result in 31 days in Jail with Huber privileges, consecutive.  

Days credit for time already served: 2 days in 21CF2 
Defendant is to report to Probation no later than 3:00 pm today 
Firearms prohibition and Appeal rights given to Defendant
recess 9:37 am
Status conference on September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on May 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.

[ml] Cases 21CF2, 21CF10, 21CF64, 21CF226, and 22CF192 called at 10:25AM
Defendant Joshua C Amend in court with attorney Steven John Luchsinger. ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Att Luchsinger advises that the Defense is prepared to proceed with trial next week.
The State advises that it is prepared to proceed with trial in three of the four cases, noting that an officer witness is not available for file 21CF64. The State requests that the trial in that file be continued to another date. The Defense does not object.

Att Luchsinger advises that he will be the record of attorney as to file 22CF192.

recess 10:29AM

-------------------------------

reconvene at 10:31AM
All appearances remain the same.

The State advises that a Victim would like to be heard.
An alleged victim makes a statement to the Court.

recess 10:32AM

NEXT: Court Trial  remains on the Court's calendar (Other cases to track along for Status)
Status conference on May 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

[ae] case called 10:39 AM Defendant Joshua C Amend in court. ADA Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel is given.  
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $2500 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence towards any person
--no contact with Victim 1 unless or until permitted by DOC and then contact shall be in any method approved by DOC
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)

recess 10:47 am
NEXT: (1) Status Conference on 5/20/22 at 10:00 am
Defendant has pending case assigned to Branch 3
Proposed Order to Seal Victim Key

Victim Witness Key
The original document name was titled: Victim Witness Key
The original history event date is: 04-18-2022
